branches.name: WRLINUX_10_24_LTS
branches.short_description: Wind River Linux 10_24 Long Term Support

layerItems.description:
OpenEmbedded-Core is a layer containing the core metadata for current versions
of OpenEmbedded. It is distro-less (can build a functional image with
DISTRO = "nodistro") and contains only emulated machine support.
layerItems.name: openembedded-core

layerItems.description:
Official layer for Intel platform/board support. This layer itself (at the top level) contains common components, and then there are sub-layers for each BSP which are listed individually in this index.

This layer includes support for DPDK.
layerItems.name: meta-intel

machines.description: 64 bit Intel Skylake CPU (and later) with MMX, SSE, SSE2, SSE3, SSE4.1, SSE4.2, AVX, and AVX2 instruction set support. Supports a moderately wide range of drivers that should boot and be usable on "typical" hardware.
machines.name: intel-skylake-64

machines.description: 64 bit Intel Core i7 CPU (and later) with MMX, SSE, SSE2, SSE3, and SSSE3 instruction set support. Supports a moderately wide range of drivers that should boot and be usable on "typical" hardware.
machines.name: intel-corei7-64

machines.description: 32 bit Intel Core 2 CPU (and later) with MMX, SSE, SSE2, SSE3, and SSSE3 instruction set support. Supports a moderately wide range of drivers that should boot and be usable on "typical" hardware.
machines.name: intel-core2-32

recipes.description: Native host tools to generate the container images in a binary file format understood by Slim Bootloader to load and initializeOperating Systems or Hypervisors.

recipes.description: MEETEE library provides a cross-platform simple  programing interface for accessing Intel HECI interfaces on devices  found in BigCore and Atom based products.

recipes.description: The oneAPI Video Processing Library (oneVPL) provides a single video processing API for encode, decode, and video processing that works across a wide range of accelerators.
recipes.summary: oneAPI Video Processing Library

recipes.description: Intel(R) oneVPL runtime provides an runtime to access hardware-accelerated video decode, encode and filtering on Intel® graphics.
recipes.summary: Intel(R) oneVPL runtime for Intel GPU accelerated media processing

recipes.description: Intel Media Driver for VAAPI is a new VA-API (Video Acceleration API) user mode driver supporting hardware accelerated decoding, encoding, and video post processing for GEN based graphics hardware.
recipes.summary: VA driver for Intel Gen based graphics hardware

recipes.description: intel-vaapi-driver is the VA-API implementation for Intel G45 chipsets and Intel HD Graphics for Intel Core processor family.

recipes.description: The Instrumentation and Tracing Technology (ITT) API enables application to generate and control the collection of trace data during its execution across different Intel tools.
recipes.summary: Intel® Instrumentation and Tracing Technology (ITT) and Just-In-Time (JIT) API

recipes.description: Intel(R) Media SDK provides an API to access hardware-accelerated video decode, encode and filtering on Intel® platforms with integrated graphics.
recipes.summary: Intel(R) Media SDK for hardware accelerated media processing

recipes.description: The Intel Processor Trace (Intel PT) Decoder Library is Intel's reference implementation for decoding Intel PT. It can be used as a standalone library or it can be partially or fully integrated into your tool.
recipes.summary: Intel(R) Processor Trace Decoder Library

recipes.summary: Intel® oneAPI runtime libraries environment set up

recipes.description: Intel® Integrated Performance Primitives (Intel® IPP) Cryptography is a secure, fast and lightweight library of building blocks for cryptography, highly-optimized for various Intel® CPUs.
recipes.summary: Crypto Multi-buffer Library

recipes.description: The oneAPI DPC++ Library (oneDPL) aims to work with the oneAPI DPC++ Compiler to provide high-productivity APIs to developers, which can minimize DPC++ programming efforts across devices for high performance parallel applications.
recipes.summary: oneAPI DPC++ Library (oneDPL)

recipes.description: The Intel(R) Graphics Compute Runtime for OpenCL(TM) is an open source project to converge Intel's development efforts on OpenCL(TM) compute stacks supporting the GEN graphics hardware architecture.
recipes.summary: The Intel(R) Graphics Compute Runtime for OpenCL(TM)

recipes.description: This software is a user mode library that acceleratesdeep-learning applications and frameworks on Intel architecture.
recipes.summary: Deep Neural Network Library

recipes.description: Intel Local Manageability Service allows applications to access the Intel Active Management Technology (AMT) firmware via the Intel Management Engine Interface (MEI).

recipes.description: Thermal Daemon is a Linux daemon used to prevent the overheating of platforms. This daemon monitors temperature and applies compensation using available cooling methods.

recipes.summary: Linux thermal daemon

recipes.description: Utility for configuring and managing Intel Optane Persistent Memory modules (PMem). It supports functionality to: Discover DCPMMs on the platform. Provision the platform memory configuration. View and update the firmware on DCPMMs. Configure data-at-rest security on DCPMMs. Track health and performance of DCPMMs. Debug and troubleshoot DCPMMs.
recipes.summary: Utility for managing Intel Optane DC persistent memory modules

recipes.description: This toolkit allows developers to deploy pre-trained deep learning models through a high-level C++ Inference Engine API integrated with application logic.
recipes.summary: OpenVINO(TM) Toolkit - Deep Learning Deployment Toolkit

recipes.description: This repository includes optimized deep learning models and a set of demos to expedite development of high-performance deep learning inference applications.
recipes.summary: OpenVINO(TM) Toolkit - Open Model Zoo repository

recipes.description: Intel® Integrated Performance Primitives are production-ready  building blocks for cross-platform performance. Develop high-performance vision,  signal, security, and storage applications with this multithreaded software library.

Intel(R) Open Volume Kernel Library (Intel(R) Open VKL) is a collection of high-performance volume computation kernels. The target users of Open VKL are graphics application engineers who want to improve the performance of their volume rendering applications by leveraging Open VKL’s performance-optimized kernels, which include volume traversal and sampling functionality for a variety of volumetric data formats. The kernels are optimized for the latest Intel(R) processors with support for SSE, AVX, AVX2, and AVX-512 instructions.
recipes.summary: Intel(R) Open Volume Kernel Library

recipes.description: Intel OSPRay is an open source, scalable, and portable ray tracing engine for high-performance, high-fidelity visualization on Intel Architecture CPUs.
recipes.summary: Intel OSPray, Ray Tracing based Rendering Engine

recipes.description: A collection of high-performance ray tracing kernels intended to graphics application engineers that want to improve the performance of their application.
recipes.summary: Collection of high-performance ray tracing kernels

recipes.description: The Intel® oneAPI DPC++/C++ Compiler provides optimizations that help your applications run faster on Intel® 64 architectures with support for the latest C, C++, and SYCL language standards. This compiler produces optimized code that can run significantly faster by taking advantage of the ever-increasing core count and vector register width in Intel® Xeon® processors and compatible processors.
recipes.summary: Intel® oneAPI DPC++/C++ Compiler

recipes.description: The Intel® oneAPI DPC++/C++ Compiler provides optimizations that help your applications run faster on Intel® 64 architectures with support for the latest C, C++, and SYCL language standards. This compiler produces optimized code that can run significantly faster by taking advantage of the ever-increasing core count and vector register width in Intel® Xeon® processors and compatible processors.
recipes.summary: Intel® oneAPI DPC++/C++ Compiler runtime files

recipes.description: The Intel® oneAPI Math Kernel Library (oneMKL) is a computing  math library of highly optimized and extensively parallelized routines  for applications that require maximum performance. oneMKL contains  the high-performance optimizations from the full Intel® Math Kernel Library  for CPU architectures (with C/Fortran programming language interfaces) and adds to them a set of DPC++ programming language interfaces for  achieving performance on various CPU architectures  and Intel Graphics Technology for certain key functionalities.
recipes.summary: Intel® oneAPI Math Kernel Library (oneMKL)

recipes.description: A common set of C++ infrastructure and CMake utilities used by various components of Intel® oneAPI Rendering Toolkit.
recipes.summary: rkcommon - C++/CMake infrastructure

recipes.description: Intel Open Image Denoise is an open source library of high-performance, high-quality denoising filters for images rendered with ray tracing. Intel Open Image Denoise is part of the Intel® oneAPI Rendering Toolkit
recipes.summary: Intel® Open Image Denoise

recipes.description: ispc is a compiler for a variant of the C programming language, with extensions for single program, multiple data programming.
recipes.summary: Intel(R) Implicit SPMD Program Compiler
oneAPI Level Zero Specification Headers and Loader

recipes.description: Model Optimizer is a cross-platform command-line tool that facilitates the transition between the training and deployment environment, performs static model analysis, and adjusts deep learning models for optimal execution on end-point target devices.

recipes.description: This virtual function driver supports kernel versions 2.6.x and newer This driver supports 82599, X540, X550, and X552-based virtual function devices that can only be activated on kernels that support SR-IOV. SR-IOV requires the correct platform and OS support. The guest OS loading this driver must support MSI-X interrupts.

recipes.description: This software is a user mode library that provides access to GPU performance data.
recipes.summary: Intel Metrics Discovery Application Programming Interface

recipes.description: Video Acceleration API (VA API) is a library (libVA) and API specification which enables and provides access to graphics hardware (GPU) acceleration for video processing on Linux and UNIX based operating systems. Accelerated processing includes video decoding, video encoding, subpicture blending and rendering. The specification was originally designed by Intel for its GMA (Graphics Media Accelerator) series of GPU hardware, the API is however not limited to GPUs or Intel specific hardware, as other hardware and manufacturers can also freely use this API for hardware accelerated video decoding.
recipes.inherits: meson meson-routines pkgconfig python3-dir python3native qemu siteinfo
recipes.summary: Video Acceleration (VA) API for Linux

recipes.description: libva-utils is a collection of utilities and examples to exercise VA-API in accordance with the libva project.VA-API is an open-source library and API specification, which provides access to graphics hardware acceleration capabilities for video processing. It consists of a main library and driver-specific acceleration backends for each supported hardware vendor
recipes.inherits: features_check meson meson-routines pkgconfig python3-dir python3native qemu siteinfo
recipes.summary: libva-utils is a collection of utilities from libva project

recipes.description: The Intel(R) Graphics Memory Management Library provides device specific and buffer management for the Intel(R) Graphics Compute Runtime for OpenCL(TM) and the Intel(R) Media Driver for VAAPI.
recipes.summary: Intel(R) Graphics Memory Management Library

recipes.description: ast is an Xorg driver for ASpeed Technologies video cards
recipes.summary: X.Org X server -- ASpeed Technologies graphics driver

recipes.description: This is a user space implementation to prevent copying of digital audio & video content across digital display interfaces. It provides Linux user space implementation to enable the HDCP1.4 and HDCP2.2 protection for external digital display interface
recipes.inherits: cmake features_check pkgconfig systemd useradd useradd_base
recipes.summary: Intel(R) unified HDCP SDK

recipes.description: iucode_tool is a program to manipulate Intel i686 and X86-64 processor microcode update collections, and to use the kernel facilities to update the microcode on Intel system processors.  It can load microcode data files in text and binary format, sort, list and filter the microcode updates contained in these files, write selected microcode updates to a new file in binary format, or upload them to the kernel.  It operates on microcode data downloaded directly from Intel: http://feeds.downloadcenter.intel.com/rss/?p=2371
recipes.summary: Update Intel CPU microcode

recipes.description: The microcode data file contains the latest microcode definitions for all Intel processors. Intel releases microcode updates to correct processor behavior as documented in the respective processor specification updates. While the regular approach to getting this microcode update is via a BIOS upgrade, Intel realizes that this can be an administrative hassle. The Linux operating system and VMware ESX products have a mechanism to update the microcode after booting. For example, this file will be used by the operating system mechanism if the file is placed in the /etc/firmware directory of the Linux system.
recipes.summary: Intel Processor Microcode Datafile for Linux
